title: Nez Perce National Historical Park: Scenic Vistas
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Environmental Factors     Scenic Vistas                Scenic Vistas      From many places in their traditional homeland, the Nimiipuu could see grand vistas of land that had been created for them. Today, the management of natural resources on private lands and also within the park directly affects, and has the potential to impact, other significant resources such as cultural landscapes and scenic vistas. Many have come to hold the landscapes and views of park lands as one of the its most valuable assets. These include scenes of early exploration, fur trade, missionary zeal, mining and agriculture, westward expansion of the nation, Nez Perce/United States conflict, and a continuation of the culture of the Nez Perce country.  Â     Smoking Place is a site along the Lewis and Clark trail, near the 500 road above the Lochsa River. Wildfire smoke may block views during the summer season. NPS Photo
